subject: p10268877
History: A-year-old man after PEA arrest, pulmonary edema, currently intubated. ET tube changed.
Impression: AP chest compared to : ET tube in standard placement. Nasogastric tube passes into the stomach and out of view. No pneumothorax. Leftward mediastinal shift suggests a new opacification at the base of the left lung is atelectasis. The right lung is clear. Left jugular line ends at the origin of the SVC.
